intro: Senecio puracensis, commonly known as the Puracén White Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, specifically in the Andean foothills of Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is known for its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Senecio puracensis typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a unique and attractive addition to alpine gardens and botanical collections.
